name: reviving
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
revive
C2 to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use: to revive someone's hopes/confidence/fortunes My plants revived as soon as I gave them some water. A hot shower and a cup of tea will revive you. Traditional skills are being revived. Synonyms
bring someone around (MAKE CONSCIOUS)
revivify formal
More examplesFewer examplesThey recognized that the country would revive only if it thoroughly disengaged from the chaos of the old regime.How can the Trade Department be revived from its present moribund state?The peace plan put forward last August has been revived for the latest round of negotiations.Nobody fully understands the enormity and complexity of the task of reviving the country's economy.This would seem to be an opportune moment for reviving our development plan.
